ul.li: if you would like to experiment with gcc-3.4, use the gcc34-amd64-2004.1 profile
gcc-3.4 is currently supported by the toolchain herd
xfree-4.3.0 is deprecated in Gentoo/AMD64, use xorg-x11 instead (install guide)
kernel 2.4.x is officially deprecated in Gentoo/AMD64
Use the emachines kernel included on the LiveCD for eMachines laptops
Use the gentoo kernel for uni-processor computers
Use the smp kernel for multi-processor Opteron computers
sys-kernel/gentoo-dev-sources is the only supported kernel sources on Gentoo/AMD64
Firewire support will break if you enable kernel preemption in newer kernels (>=2.6.4)
GRUB is only available in static form, using the grub-static ebuild
A dual 32-bit/64-bit environment is possible, with some limitations
NEVER add x86 or ~x86 to your ACCEPT_KEYWORDS
NEVER use -0s in your CFLAGS on the AMD64 platform
Pass idle=poll to the kernel at boot if you are getting kernel panics
MPT Fusion SCSI cards require iommu=merge to be passed to the kernel at boot time
Only channels 1 and 2 work on the Silicon Image 3114 SATA controller
You don't need to put -march=k8 in your CFLAGS since there is only one x86-64 CPU at the moment
You must have IA32 Emulation turned on in Executable File Formats in your kernel for 32-bit emulation (and 32-bit chroot) to work
OpenOffice must be installed from binaries (openoffice-bin) with FEATURES="-sandbox"
The Livecd doesn't autodetect 3Com 3c940 network chips, you have to manually modprobe sk98lin
